page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY CONT
page.content: return journey from Waterloo.The railway came in 1859. Bramshott War Memorial Recreational Ground is situated down the A3 off the Liphook roundabout. It belongs to Bramshott Parish council. It is the home of Liphook football club who play and train there. There are facilities for bowles,cricket, tennis, football and 2 sections with playing equipment like swings and roundabouts. There are clubs which meet there. It is very safe for children to play and there's plenty to do. There are 2 buildings: one is a bar which people go to after a game; and the other is changing rooms, with a room on top with a glass front for the groundsmen to watch out of. It is a big attraction as it caters for small babies to old age pensioners.
